intro: Myrsine virgata, commonly known as the New Zealand myrsine, is a small evergreen shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in cymes, followed by black, spherical berries. Myrsine virgata is often found in moist, shaded forest environments, where it thrives in the understorey. It plays an important ecological role in supporting local insect and bird populations.
